greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of values of k, 1<=k<=n, for which floor(n/k) is prime.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If p is a prime other than 3, a(p) = a(p-1) + 1. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Apr 27 2020
example: a(10) = 4 as floor(10/k) for k = 1 to 10 is 10,5,3,2,2,1,1,1,1,1, respectively; this is prime for k = 2,3,4,5.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Feb 12 2002
